pullRequest.title: [BACKPORT] Avoid using on-heap indexes while indexing is in progress
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixed the race condition checking that all partitions are indexed
before using an index for query. In combination with migration stamp
check which guarantees there is no concurrent partition migration,
the using of incomplete index is avoided and query engine falls back to
the full partitions scan algorithm.
Fixes: #16311

nodes.bodyText: The implementation of this class looks suspicious to me. Evaluate predicate is an indexed predicate over some other predicate. matchIndex may return null if the target index is not ready, causing NPE during query execution. We need to add tests for bitmap indexes in addition to existing tests, to make sure that the logic works properly.

Shouldn't we do something like this instead?
return queryContext.matchIndex(indexName, QueryContext.IndexMatchHint.EXACT_NAME, ownedPartitionCount) != null;

EvaluatePredicate already assume that we decided to use an index, so we should not check the nested predicate. Instead, we should use EvaluatePredicate.indexName with EXACT_NAME rule to check if the index is ready.

Only several predicates are checked, whilst other types still may fail. E,g, AndPredicate, OrPredicate. We'd better extend the check for all built-in predicate types.
Bitmap indexes may generate different predicates during the optimization process (EvaluatePredicate), so a separate test for bitmaps is needed, with matching predicate types.

beforeCommit.message: Test bitmap indexes and more predicates

afterCommit.message:
Avoid NPE if index is under construction

Check that the matched index might be null in the query engine and if
so, don't try to use it.
Added more unit tests.

nodes.bodyText: Is it OK to pass -1 here? It seem that we may cache inconsistent results here if the check for partition count is skipped, don't we?
I am a little worried with plain -1 in many places. Shouldn't we declare it as a static final constant instead?
